section.section: Instead of or in addition to reprimanding a permit holder or suspending or revoking a beauty salon permit, the Board may impose a penalty not exceeding $300 for all violations cited on a single date.
The Board shall pay any penalty collected under this subsection into the General Fund of the State.

Except as provided in subsection (d) of this section, if the Board finds that a complaint alleges facts that are adequate grounds for action under this section, the Board shall act on the complaint as provided under § 5-523 of this subtitle to deny, suspend, or revoke a license, reprimand a licensee, or assess a penalty.
If the Board does not make the finding, the Board shall dismiss the complaint.

If the Board makes the finding under subsection (c)(1) of this section for a violation that relates to the sanitary condition of a beauty salon or the sanitary practice of cosmetology, the Board shall provide the owner of the salon an opportunity to correct the alleged violation.

If the owner fails to correct each alleged violation within 10 days of written notification of the violation by the Board, the Board shall act on the complaint as provided under § 5-523 of this subtitle.

If the owner corrects each alleged violation within 10 days of notice, the Board shall:
dismiss the complaint; and
provide the owner written notification of the dismissal.
